title: CyTOF_Derived_data.json template schema
description: The CYTOF derived data template captures and annotates the assay results for a sample by linking sample, experiment, and interpreted results together.

A leukocyte with a single non-segmented nucleus in the mature form found in the circulatory pool of blood.

A lymphocyte that lacks characteristic T cell, B cell, myeloid cell, and dendritic cell markers, that functions as part of the innate immune response to produce cytokines and other effector responses.
A mature alpha-beta T cell that expresses an alpha-beta T cell receptor and the CD4 coreceptor.
A red blood cell. In mammals, mature erythrocytes are biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.
A regulatory T cell that has not encountered antigen.

A stem cell from which all cells of the lymphoid and myeloid lineages develop, including blood cells and cells of the immune system. Hematopoietic stem cells lack cell markers of effector cells (lin-). Lin- is defined by lacking one or more of the following cell surface markers: CD2, CD3 epsilon, CD4, CD5 ,CD8 alpha chain, CD11b, CD14, CD19, CD20, CD56, ly6G, ter119.
A type I NK T cell that has the phenotype CD4+.
An alpha-beta T cell that is found in the lamina propria of mucosal tissues and is restricted by the MR-1 molecule.
An unswitched memory B cell is a memory B cell that has the phenotype IgM+, IgD+, CD27+, CD138-, IgG-, IgE-, and IgA-.
